raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Drug is not extensively distribution to tissue", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Volume of distribution (Vd) is a pharmacokinetic parameter that reflects the extent to which a drug distributes into body tissues versus remaining in plasma. A LOW Vd indicates the drug is primarily confined to the plasma/vascular compartment and does NOT extensively distribute into tissues. Vd is independent of half-life, bioavailability, and efficacy. The student confused Vd with half-life, which are separate parameters.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
